intro: Mastigostyla candaravensis, commonly known as the Malagasy cactus, is a unique plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its succulent stems and spines. The plant exhibits a low-growing, mat-forming growth habit, often covering rocky or arid landscapes. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
